intro: Rungia longifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved rungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for shade gardens and indoor cultivation.
